definition: to fall/to tumble/to trip/(of prices etc) to drop/Taiwan pr. [die2]

sentences.english: The currencies of these countries collapsed suddenly.
sentences.chinese: 这些国家的货币突然猛跌。

sentences.english: The Bolivarian leader's vaunted popularity tumbles.
sentences.chinese: 委内瑞拉玻利瓦尔共和国领导人所吹嘘的声望猛跌。

sentences.english: Marriage and fertility rates have plunged.
sentences.chinese: 结婚率和生育率已经猛跌。

sentences.english: Prices plunged. The downward spiral proved unstoppable.
sentences.chinese: 股价猛跌，而且下泻之势无法阻止。

sentences.english: Large-scale government aid looks like the only way to end the economic nosedive .
sentences.chinese: 大规模政府援助看来是终结经济猛跌的不二法门。

sentences.english: Jones was hurled into a pile of dung and his gun flew out of his hands.
sentences.chinese: 琼斯猛跌在粪堆上，手中的枪也甩了出去。

definition: to fall back (of water level or share prices)
(of a market index etc) to fall below (a given level)/to be injured or damaged as a result of a fall
(of sales, prices etc) to fall/to drop/decline/slump
to fall back/to return to low level after a rise (in water level, price etc)
(of water) to soar/(of prices) to skyrocket
to fall/to tumble/to trip/(of prices etc) to drop/Taiwan pr. [die2]
